title: second place : p.p
body:
brief summary: having a crush on your best friend, Peter and trying to spend more time with him when tony takes his suit away in the hope you’ll finally have the courage to tell him how you feel. 

word count: 2.5k
requested: yes - by @tearsforhan thanks girl!
warnings: angst, other than that nothing much 

* masterlist of sorts * 

“and Mr Stark keeps telling me I’m not ready and that it’s not safe, but I, I know I can do it.” Peter huffs as the two of you walk toward your house as you remain quiet, taking it all in as Peter explains. “What do you think?” He questions and you shut your eyes. 

It was a question you dreaded to be asked because you knew exactly what you thought, you always would. I think that it’s completely and utterly dangerous but amazing because you’re my best friend and I am also in love with you. That, that is what you thought, but refused to admit aloud.

“I think he’s got a point, Peter.” You quietly reply as you shift your books in your arms, feeling one of them slipping out from your weak grip. “It’s really risky stuff you’re putting yourself through and Tony knows what he’s talking about.”

Peter stops and blocks your path. His hands rest on your arms as he gives you a look of confusion. “Since when are you on a first name basis with Mr, Mr Stark?” 

You shrug your shoulder as you step forward, forcing Peter from your path so you can continue walking. “Since he called me to talk about you, and about your suit.” You mutter the last part, but with his spidey senses, nothing is missed with Peter. Well, almost nothing. 

“What about my suit?” His tone becomes sterner as Peter keeps his eyes on you, watching as you nervously lick your lips and keep your gaze fixated on the ground. “Y/n,” Peter drags your name out, knowing you’ll tell him if he annoys it out of you. 

A short sigh escapes your lips as you reach your front door. As you walk up the steps and place your books down you turn back to face Peter. “Tony thinks he should take your suit away for a while.” You try and break the news gently to him, but his mouth hangs open in shock as his eyes widen. 

Waving your hand in front of his face, he snaps out of it and you sit down on your front step, waiting for the rambles to commence. 

“Wwwhat Mr Stark can’t take my suit, I love my suit and don’t get me wrong the tech in it is amazing but there are alterations I’d make but I don’t want him to take it I mean why does he need to take it?” As he finishes he blankly stares at you, waiting for a response as you stutter. 

Rising to your feet, you unlock your front door and pick up your textbooks. “Honestly Peter? I think you need to talk to Tony about it.” You reply before holding the door open, but Peter remains still. “You coming in? I’m sure Mom will make some of your favourite pizza?” You beam, but Peter lowers his head shaking it.

“That’s okay, but tell your Mom I said hi. I, I’ll see you at school tomorrow.” Peter speaks softly, trying to disguise the disappointment in his tone as he walks away from your house and turns left, disappearing out of sight.

You shut your front door, leaning against it as your Mom appears from the kitchen. “Oh sweetie, I know it’s hard,” She softly tells you as she leads you into the kitchen, presenting you with a cup of coffee. “being best friends with the guy you like? Nightmare.” She chuckles as I sip the coffee. 

“So how do I get out of it being a nightmare?” You question as she switches the oven on before turning back to face you. 

“Spend quality time together. I know you and Peter are as thick as thieves. It’s just boys, especially teenage boys are oblivious to what’s in front of them.” She explains before walking back toward you, wrapping her arms tightly around you. “Once he realises, he’ll feel stupid not realising the best thing has been there all along.” 

“Thanks, Mom.” You mutter before heading upstairs, seeing several messages from Tony Stark about Peter’s suit, all of which are rather irritated responses. 

Peeping your head out to ensure no one else was upstairs, you place your coffee down before calling Tony. “About time and all young lady.” Tony huffs down the line as you sit down by your desk, smiling at a photo of you, Peter and Ned at last years summer fair. 

“I’m sorry Tony, Peter wasn’t exactly willing to listen to the idea. I gave it my best shot.” You tell him, but you know it’s not enough to just tell someone an idea, especially when that idea is Tony Starks. 

“It’s fine, kid. I’ll take the suit back tomorrow, do you think you’ll be able to keep him distracted?” Tony asks and you smile to yourself, knowing how easy of a task that can be.

“I won’t let you down.” You tell him as he hangs up, leaving you to contemplate what would be the best way to keep Peter preoccupied for a day. 

Honestly, Tony couldn’t have asked a better person. 

*

Three hours into your study session you were losing your mind, and Peter could tell. Your eyes were scanning over the same page in the hope the information will go in, but nothing will. To you, it’s just a series of words on the page meaning nothing. 

Groaning loudly you roll over on Peter’s bed, placing the book over your face. “I give up, Chemistry will be the one class I fail and I think I can accept that.” You dramatically sigh as Peter chuckles, leaning over to lift the book from your face. 

As he lifts it up, you glance up not expecting him to be so close to you. Your eyes hover on his before he moves away, allowing you to sit back upright. “It’s not so bad, Y/N/N.” He nudges your arm, always smiling at your nickname he devised for you when you were kids. “Look, if I’m stuck not being Spiderman, you’ve got to learn chemistry.” He sighs before holding his hand out in front of you. “Deal?” 

Raising an eyebrow you accept the handshake. “Deal, I guess.” You shrug your shoulder as you pick the chemistry book back up. “You better help me become the smartest person in the class Parker.” 

“I’ll make you the second smartest, how’s that?” He retorts, flashing a smile to you before focusing back on his own work. 

After a few hours of studying, you were struggling to keep your eyes open. “Getting sleepy over there?” Peter pipes up, smiling to you as you lift your head up, weakly nodding in response.

“Didn’t sleep much last night.” You admit as you rub your eyes. “Neighbours played music til 4am again so I’m still half asleep.” 

You return to reading the textbook as your eyes continue to grow heavy. Faintly, you can hear the sound of movement coming from Peter as you turn around from the floor, seeing him pulling his bedding back and the textbooks on the floor. 

“Come on,” He motions for you to join him and you can feel heat spreading through your body. “you need to get some rest, I’ll stick a movie on. Like old times.” 

Hesitantly, you rise to your feet as you climb under the covers and curl into Peter. He instinctively brings you closer, wrapping his arm around you so you can rest your head on his chest as he plays the movie. It is barely five minutes in and you’re unable to focus on it any longer. “Thank you Peter.” You mumble to him as you allow yourself to fully drift off, feeling Peter drawing shapes into your arm. 

*

Walking down the corridor, MJ continues to talk about the latest election and the drawbacks it has. Usually, you’re able to listen and provide some form of a comment, but as you look ahead you watch as Peter stands by Liz. 

It isn’t something uncommon. Peter always talks to Ned or MJ, but this is clearly different. MJ follows your line of focus and sighs to herself. “I guess Peter’s got himself a crush.” She sings to you, rolling her eyes and waiting for you to react, but you remain silent.

You watch as Peter nervously plays with the hem of his hoodie, how he is trying to stand taller and is evidently stuttering as he focuses on her. Of course, he likes Liz, she’s beautiful and smart. You’ll always be his best friend, that’s all you’ll be to him. 

“I’ll see you in class I just need the the restroom.” You mutter before turning around and running to the bathroom where you keep your head low as you rush into a cubicle, locking it as you sit down and let the tears fall. 

It’s not Peter’s fault for liking someone else. It’s your own stupid fault for not saying anything. Your Mom always said teenage boys are oblivious, but they always notice the other girls, the ones who aren’t with them 24/7 or see them in their PJs or after a battle with the Avengers. 

Sighing to yourself you take a deep breath, wipe your eyes and head to class. Chemistry class. 

As you walk in, you mutter an apology to your teacher before sitting beside MJ. Peter noticed something was wrong as soon as you didn’t walk through with everyone else. You never miss class, especially one you’re struggling in. 

Peter turns to Ned who simply shrugs his shoulders. You’re situated at the back of the lab with MJ whilst Peter sits alongside Ned and behind Liz. He smiles to himself as Liz glances over her shoulder, smiling to Peter shyly before averting her attention back to the class. 

Ned glances down to his lap, seeing a message appear on his phone from MJ. He sighs silently before placing his phone back in his pocket as he looks to Peter who remains in a world of his own, completely unaware of the reason why you were upset. 

The bell rings and the class is over. You quickly gather your things before anyone, and by anyone you mean Peter can stop you. You rush through the halls straight to the library for study hall, a chance to hide away and shut down for an hour or two. 

As Peter leaves the classroom, his eyes scan through the students hoping you were one of them. But, much to his dismay, you’re gone. “What’s wrong with Y/n?” Peter asks Ned who remains quiet, shrugging his shoulders. “Ned?” Peter asks once more, and Ned lets out a heavy sigh. 

“Since when have you liked Liz?” Ned questions and watches as heat rises to Peter’s cheeks as they wander down the corridor toward the library. “I know, she’s really pretty but you didn’t tell me you liked her.” 

Peter pulls the strap on his backpack uncomfortably. “I’m not sure, she’s really nice to me and smart. We, we have a lot in common I guess.” Peter says uncertainly, and MJ walks alongside them.

“You’re breaking Y/n’s heart, you know that, Parker?” She coldly comments before picking up her pace, walking out of sight before Peter can question what she just told him. 

Ned averts his gaze as they walk into the library. “What’d she mean I’m,” Before Peter can finish his sentence he is shushed by the librarian. “sorry Ms Pells.” He whispers as he follows Ned up the stairs and into the room out the back. 

Curled up in the corner of the back room, you allow yourself to hide away behind the bookshelves. A small sofa is situated that only a few know of, it’s your small spot to fully shut yourself out from school and in this case, from Peter. 

Your ears perk up as the door opens and closes. “Well? What did I do wrong?” Silently you swear to yourself as you recognise that voice having heard it for every single day for years. 

“You really have no clue, do you?” Ned chuckles softly as you sink further into the sofa, wishing the ground would swallow you whole or that there was an emergency escape from the room. 

Peter holds his arms up in defeat. “What are you talking about?” 

“The fact that Y/n likes you, Peter?” Ned states and Peter chuckles a sound that slowly cracks your heart.

“Of course she likes me, she’s my best friend.” Peter laughs it off, but as Ned continues to stare at him, his laughter dies down. “Oh.” 

“Yeah.” Ned replies as Peter moves to sit down.

“How, how did I not notice?” He stutters. 

Ned shrugs his shoulders. “We all can see it, Peter. Y/n really cares about you, but do you feel the same?” 

The question hangs heavy in the air as tears well up in your eyes. It was a question you’ve wanted to hear the answer to for months but you’ve been too afraid to ask it. Yet, here it is. The one time you shouldn’t hear it, you’re given no choice. 

“I think so.” Peter says with confusion in his voice. “I mean, yeah, yeah.” 

“Then what’s stopping you?” MJ’s voice interrupts and Peter stutters. “You know this part of the library has hidden spots right?” You listen as her voice becomes closer. “Such as the back corner behind the election files from 1982 to 1987?” 

Peter looks dumbfounded as he rises to his feet, following MJ as he turns the corner to see you curled up. “H,hi.” You whisper, afraid to meet Peter’s gaze. 

“We’ll leave you two.” MJ states as she takes a hold of Ned, dragging him away and closes the door behind them. 

Shuffling on the spot it suddenly feels like neither of you knows your boundaries. It’s like being in the first grade when you’re unsure of who to talk to, who could become a friend for life or just for the first few days. 

“I, I don’t bite.” You mutter and watch a small smile form on Peter’s face as he sits down opposite you, leaning forward. “I didn’t mean to hear all that, we can, we can forget about it if it’s awkward.”

“I don’t wanna forget it, Y/n.” Peter responds and you lift your head up, seeing his eyes focused on you. “Why would I want to forget it?” 

“Because it’s stupid and you don’t like me like that, as I’m your best friend.” You force a laugh that cracks as tears threaten to spill. 

Peter slides off of the sofa, kneeling in front of you as he takes your hands in his. “Hey, it’s me, okay?” Peter strokes your hands with his thumbs. “You’re my best friend, and you always will be, but I’ve always wondered what if we went to being in a relationship.” He smiles softly, having thought about it for hours at night when you would leave his apartment or he’d walk home from yours. “Can’t imagine it being that different.” 

You smile as you sniff lightly. “So you’re saying you want to give this a go?” 

“Do you?” Peter retorts and you nod repeatedly. “Well then,” He mutters as he rises to his feet, holding his hand out to you. “Y/N/N, will you be my girlfriend?” 

Placing his hands on your waist, you lift your hands up around his neck. “I’d love to Spidey.” You mumble before leaning closer and kissing Peter for the first time, the first of many to come.

“I, I don’t bite.” You mutter and watch a small smile form on Peter’s face as he sits down opposite you, leaning forward. “I didn’t mean to hear all that, we can, we can forget about it if it’s awkward.”

“I don’t wanna forget it, Y/n.” Peter responds and you lift your head up, seeing his eyes focused on you. “Why would I want to forget it?” 

“Because it’s stupid and you don’t like me like that, as I’m your best friend.” You force a laugh that cracks as tears threaten to spill. 

Peter slides off of the sofa, kneeling in front of you as he takes your hands in his. “Hey, it’s me, okay?” Peter strokes your hands with his thumbs. “You’re my best friend, and you always will be, but I’ve always wondered what if we went to being in a relationship.” He smiles softly, having thought about it for hours at night when you would leave his apartment or he’d walk home from yours. “Can’t imagine it being that different.” 

You smile as you sniff lightly. “So you’re saying you want to give this a go?” 

“Do you?” Peter retorts and you nod repeatedly. “Well then,” He mutters as he rises to his feet, holding his hand out to you. “Y/N/N, will you be my girlfriend?” 

Placing his hands on your waist, you lift your hands up around his neck. “I’d love to Spidey.” You mumble before leaning closer and kissing Peter for the first time, the first of many to come.

trail.content_raw:
brief summary: having a crush on your best friend, Peter and trying to spend more time with him when tony takes his suit away in the hope you’ll finally have the courage to tell him how you feel. 

word count: 2.5k
requested: yes - by @tearsforhan thanks girl!
warnings: angst, other than that nothing much 

* masterlist of sorts * 

“and Mr Stark keeps telling me I’m not ready and that it’s not safe, but I, I know I can do it.” Peter huffs as the two of you walk toward your house as you remain quiet, taking it all in as Peter explains. “What do you think?” He questions and you shut your eyes. 

It was a question you dreaded to be asked because you knew exactly what you thought, you always would. I think that it’s completely and utterly dangerous but amazing because you’re my best friend and I am also in love with you. That, that is what you thought, but refused to admit aloud.

“I think he’s got a point, Peter.” You quietly reply as you shift your books in your arms, feeling one of them slipping out from your weak grip. “It’s really risky stuff you’re putting yourself through and Tony knows what he’s talking about.”

Peter stops and blocks your path. His hands rest on your arms as he gives you a look of confusion. “Since when are you on a first name basis with Mr, Mr Stark?” 

You shrug your shoulder as you step forward, forcing Peter from your path so you can continue walking. “Since he called me to talk about you, and about your suit.” You mutter the last part, but with his spidey senses, nothing is missed with Peter. Well, almost nothing. 

“What about my suit?” His tone becomes sterner as Peter keeps his eyes on you, watching as you nervously lick your lips and keep your gaze fixated on the ground. “Y/n,” Peter drags your name out, knowing you’ll tell him if he annoys it out of you. 

A short sigh escapes your lips as you reach your front door. As you walk up the steps and place your books down you turn back to face Peter. “Tony thinks he should take your suit away for a while.” You try and break the news gently to him, but his mouth hangs open in shock as his eyes widen. 

Waving your hand in front of his face, he snaps out of it and you sit down on your front step, waiting for the rambles to commence. 

[[MORE]]

“Wwwhat Mr Stark can’t take my suit, I love my suit and don’t get me wrong the tech in it is amazing but there are alterations I’d make but I don’t want him to take it I mean why does he need to take it?” As he finishes he blankly stares at you, waiting for a response as you stutter. 

Rising to your feet, you unlock your front door and pick up your textbooks. “Honestly Peter? I think you need to talk to Tony about it.” You reply before holding the door open, but Peter remains still. “You coming in? I’m sure Mom will make some of your favourite pizza?” You beam, but Peter lowers his head shaking it.

“That’s okay, but tell your Mom I said hi. I, I’ll see you at school tomorrow.” Peter speaks softly, trying to disguise the disappointment in his tone as he walks away from your house and turns left, disappearing out of sight.

You shut your front door, leaning against it as your Mom appears from the kitchen. “Oh sweetie, I know it’s hard,” She softly tells you as she leads you into the kitchen, presenting you with a cup of coffee. “being best friends with the guy you like? Nightmare.” She chuckles as I sip the coffee. 

“So how do I get out of it being a nightmare?” You question as she switches the oven on before turning back to face you. 

“Spend quality time together. I know you and Peter are as thick as thieves. It’s just boys, especially teenage boys are oblivious to what’s in front of them.” She explains before walking back toward you, wrapping her arms tightly around you. “Once he realises, he’ll feel stupid not realising the best thing has been there all along.” 

“Thanks, Mom.” You mutter before heading upstairs, seeing several messages from Tony Stark about Peter’s suit, all of which are rather irritated responses. 

Peeping your head out to ensure no one else was upstairs, you place your coffee down before calling Tony. “About time and all young lady.” Tony huffs down the line as you sit down by your desk, smiling at a photo of you, Peter and Ned at last years summer fair. 

“I’m sorry Tony, Peter wasn’t exactly willing to listen to the idea. I gave it my best shot.” You tell him, but you know it’s not enough to just tell someone an idea, especially when that idea is Tony Starks. 

“It’s fine, kid. I’ll take the suit back tomorrow, do you think you’ll be able to keep him distracted?” Tony asks and you smile to yourself, knowing how easy of a task that can be.

“I won’t let you down.” You tell him as he hangs up, leaving you to contemplate what would be the best way to keep Peter preoccupied for a day. 

Honestly, Tony couldn’t have asked a better person. 

*

Three hours into your study session you were losing your mind, and Peter could tell. Your eyes were scanning over the same page in the hope the information will go in, but nothing will. To you, it’s just a series of words on the page meaning nothing. 

Groaning loudly you roll over on Peter’s bed, placing the book over your face. “I give up, Chemistry will be the one class I fail and I think I can accept that.” You dramatically sigh as Peter chuckles, leaning over to lift the book from your face. 

As he lifts it up, you glance up not expecting him to be so close to you. Your eyes hover on his before he moves away, allowing you to sit back upright. “It’s not so bad, Y/N/N.” He nudges your arm, always smiling at your nickname he devised for you when you were kids. “Look, if I’m stuck not being Spiderman, you’ve got to learn chemistry.” He sighs before holding his hand out in front of you. “Deal?” 

Raising an eyebrow you accept the handshake. “Deal, I guess.” You shrug your shoulder as you pick the chemistry book back up. “You better help me become the smartest person in the class Parker.” 

“I’ll make you the second smartest, how’s that?” He retorts, flashing a smile to you before focusing back on his own work. 

After a few hours of studying, you were struggling to keep your eyes open. “Getting sleepy over there?” Peter pipes up, smiling to you as you lift your head up, weakly nodding in response.

“Didn’t sleep much last night.” You admit as you rub your eyes. “Neighbours played music til 4am again so I’m still half asleep.” 

You return to reading the textbook as your eyes continue to grow heavy. Faintly, you can hear the sound of movement coming from Peter as you turn around from the floor, seeing him pulling his bedding back and the textbooks on the floor. 

“Come on,” He motions for you to join him and you can feel heat spreading through your body. “you need to get some rest, I’ll stick a movie on. Like old times.” 

Hesitantly, you rise to your feet as you climb under the covers and curl into Peter. He instinctively brings you closer, wrapping his arm around you so you can rest your head on his chest as he plays the movie. It is barely five minutes in and you’re unable to focus on it any longer. “Thank you Peter.” You mumble to him as you allow yourself to fully drift off, feeling Peter drawing shapes into your arm. 

*

Walking down the corridor, MJ continues to talk about the latest election and the drawbacks it has. Usually, you’re able to listen and provide some form of a comment, but as you look ahead you watch as Peter stands by Liz. 

It isn’t something uncommon. Peter always talks to Ned or MJ, but this is clearly different. MJ follows your line of focus and sighs to herself. “I guess Peter’s got himself a crush.” She sings to you, rolling her eyes and waiting for you to react, but you remain silent.

You watch as Peter nervously plays with the hem of his hoodie, how he is trying to stand taller and is evidently stuttering as he focuses on her. Of course, he likes Liz, she’s beautiful and smart. You’ll always be his best friend, that’s all you’ll be to him. 

“I’ll see you in class I just need the the restroom.” You mutter before turning around and running to the bathroom where you keep your head low as you rush into a cubicle, locking it as you sit down and let the tears fall. 

It’s not Peter’s fault for liking someone else. It’s your own stupid fault for not saying anything. Your Mom always said teenage boys are oblivious, but they always notice the other girls, the ones who aren’t with them 24/7 or see them in their PJs or after a battle with the Avengers. 

Sighing to yourself you take a deep breath, wipe your eyes and head to class. Chemistry class. 

As you walk in, you mutter an apology to your teacher before sitting beside MJ. Peter noticed something was wrong as soon as you didn’t walk through with everyone else. You never miss class, especially one you’re struggling in. 

Peter turns to Ned who simply shrugs his shoulders. You’re situated at the back of the lab with MJ whilst Peter sits alongside Ned and behind Liz. He smiles to himself as Liz glances over her shoulder, smiling to Peter shyly before averting her attention back to the class. 

Ned glances down to his lap, seeing a message appear on his phone from MJ. He sighs silently before placing his phone back in his pocket as he looks to Peter who remains in a world of his own, completely unaware of the reason why you were upset. 

The bell rings and the class is over. You quickly gather your things before anyone, and by anyone you mean Peter can stop you. You rush through the halls straight to the library for study hall, a chance to hide away and shut down for an hour or two. 

As Peter leaves the classroom, his eyes scan through the students hoping you were one of them. But, much to his dismay, you’re gone. “What’s wrong with Y/n?” Peter asks Ned who remains quiet, shrugging his shoulders. “Ned?” Peter asks once more, and Ned lets out a heavy sigh. 

“Since when have you liked Liz?” Ned questions and watches as heat rises to Peter’s cheeks as they wander down the corridor toward the library. “I know, she’s really pretty but you didn’t tell me you liked her.” 

Peter pulls the strap on his backpack uncomfortably. “I’m not sure, she’s really nice to me and smart. We, we have a lot in common I guess.” Peter says uncertainly, and MJ walks alongside them.

“You’re breaking Y/n’s heart, you know that, Parker?” She coldly comments before picking up her pace, walking out of sight before Peter can question what she just told him. 

Ned averts his gaze as they walk into the library. “What’d she mean I’m,” Before Peter can finish his sentence he is shushed by the librarian. “sorry Ms Pells.” He whispers as he follows Ned up the stairs and into the room out the back. 

Curled up in the corner of the back room, you allow yourself to hide away behind the bookshelves. A small sofa is situated that only a few know of, it’s your small spot to fully shut yourself out from school and in this case, from Peter. 

Your ears perk up as the door opens and closes. “Well? What did I do wrong?” Silently you swear to yourself as you recognise that voice having heard it for every single day for years. 

“You really have no clue, do you?” Ned chuckles softly as you sink further into the sofa, wishing the ground would swallow you whole or that there was an emergency escape from the room. 

Peter holds his arms up in defeat. “What are you talking about?” 

“The fact that Y/n likes you, Peter?” Ned states and Peter chuckles a sound that slowly cracks your heart.

“Of course she likes me, she’s my best friend.” Peter laughs it off, but as Ned continues to stare at him, his laughter dies down. “Oh.” 

“Yeah.” Ned replies as Peter moves to sit down.

“How, how did I not notice?” He stutters. 

Ned shrugs his shoulders. “We all can see it, Peter. Y/n really cares about you, but do you feel the same?” 

The question hangs heavy in the air as tears well up in your eyes. It was a question you’ve wanted to hear the answer to for months but you’ve been too afraid to ask it. Yet, here it is. The one time you shouldn’t hear it, you’re given no choice. 

“I think so.” Peter says with confusion in his voice. “I mean, yeah, yeah.” 

“Then what’s stopping you?” MJ’s voice interrupts and Peter stutters. “You know this part of the library has hidden spots right?” You listen as her voice becomes closer. “Such as the back corner behind the election files from 1982 to 1987?” 

Peter looks dumbfounded as he rises to his feet, following MJ as he turns the corner to see you curled up. “H,hi.” You whisper, afraid to meet Peter’s gaze. 

“We’ll leave you two.” MJ states as she takes a hold of Ned, dragging him away and closes the door behind them. 

Shuffling on the spot it suddenly feels like neither of you knows your boundaries. It’s like being in the first grade when you’re unsure of who to talk to, who could become a friend for life or just for the first few days. 

“I, I don’t bite.” You mutter and watch a small smile form on Peter’s face as he sits down opposite you, leaning forward. “I didn’t mean to hear all that, we can, we can forget about it if it’s awkward.”

“I don’t wanna forget it, Y/n.” Peter responds and you lift your head up, seeing his eyes focused on you. “Why would I want to forget it?” 

“Because it’s stupid and you don’t like me like that, as I’m your best friend.” You force a laugh that cracks as tears threaten to spill. 

Peter slides off of the sofa, kneeling in front of you as he takes your hands in his. “Hey, it’s me, okay?” Peter strokes your hands with his thumbs. “You’re my best friend, and you always will be, but I’ve always wondered what if we went to being in a relationship.” He smiles softly, having thought about it for hours at night when you would leave his apartment or he’d walk home from yours. “Can’t imagine it being that different.” 

You smile as you sniff lightly. “So you’re saying you want to give this a go?” 

“Do you?” Peter retorts and you nod repeatedly. “Well then,” He mutters as he rises to his feet, holding his hand out to you. “Y/N/N, will you be my girlfriend?” 

Placing his hands on your waist, you lift your hands up around his neck. “I’d love to Spidey.” You mumble before leaning closer and kissing Peter for the first time, the first of many to come.

“and Mr Stark keeps telling me I’m not ready and that it’s not safe, but I, I know I can do it.” Peter huffs as the two of you walk toward your house as you remain quiet, taking it all in as Peter explains. “What do you think?” He questions and you shut your eyes. 

It was a question you dreaded to be asked because you knew exactly what you thought, you always would. I think that it’s completely and utterly dangerous but amazing because you’re my best friend and I am also in love with you. That, that is what you thought, but refused to admit aloud.

“I think he’s got a point, Peter.” You quietly reply as you shift your books in your arms, feeling one of them slipping out from your weak grip. “It’s really risky stuff you’re putting yourself through and Tony knows what he’s talking about.”

Peter stops and blocks your path. His hands rest on your arms as he gives you a look of confusion. “Since when are you on a first name basis with Mr, Mr Stark?” 

You shrug your shoulder as you step forward, forcing Peter from your path so you can continue walking. “Since he called me to talk about you, and about your suit.” You mutter the last part, but with his spidey senses, nothing is missed with Peter. Well, almost nothing. 

“What about my suit?” His tone becomes sterner as Peter keeps his eyes on you, watching as you nervously lick your lips and keep your gaze fixated on the ground. “Y/n,” Peter drags your name out, knowing you’ll tell him if he annoys it out of you. 

A short sigh escapes your lips as you reach your front door. As you walk up the steps and place your books down you turn back to face Peter. “Tony thinks he should take your suit away for a while.” You try and break the news gently to him, but his mouth hangs open in shock as his eyes widen. 

Waving your hand in front of his face, he snaps out of it and you sit down on your front step, waiting for the rambles to commence.

summary: GIMME
body:
GIMME

Gimme a Parkner/Spiderlad/Parley/Keenker fic where either Harley or Peter pass out from a high fever and the other has to take care of them for the rest of the day-

LIKE IMAGINE

Peter coming to school with a super high fever even though May said he should really be resting. Peter being the stubborn ass boy he is of course didn’t listen, or maybe he couldn’t listen because of the fever.

Then of course the Parker luck strikes again, the fever gets worse and worse as the day goes by. Peter could barely stand at this point and looked like he just git hit by a train. Once Peter actually got to P.E he’s all dizzy and practically drenched in sweat. He stumbles for a bit before accidentally bumping in to Harley.

Before Peter could even face plat to the ground Harley catches him with both arms looking at him with concerned eyes. He rose an eyebrow at Peter’s utterly dying form before gently letting go of his boyfriend. He questions Peter about it only for the other boy to shrug all his questions off.

Harley doesn’t get majorly concerned, he knew Peter could handle himself. After all Peter did dress up as a red spider furry and beat up bad guys all night. Harley didn’t think anything of the confrontation until he saw Peter stumble by the benches before dropping out cold and nearly the floor.

Harley being the oh so good boyfriend he was managed to catch Peter before his head could drop to the ground. In all honesty Harley was VERY scared and concerned. I mean wouldn’t you if your boyfriend suddenly dropped out cold like he just died? He quickly pushed those thoughts away at the back of his mind before lifting Peter’s body up and sprint to the nurse’s office even with the teachers yelling at him to stop running in the halls.

He sets Peter on the bed and just waits for him to wake up. It was literally torture for Harley but there was nothing else to do besides waiting. So he sat there, resting his face near Peter’s sleeping one, and waited for the other boy to wake up. Peter did eventually wake up though only to find a sleeping Harley next to him instead.

Imagine them staying like that until Peter silently fell asleep again, slowly waking up to find himself in his room at the tower. Harley was in front of him sitting on a chair, holding a bowl of chicken noodle soup. Once Peter opened his mouth to say something Harley shoved a spoon full of soup down his throat before placing the soup on the bed side table and hugged Peter to death. Peter hugged Harley back even though he wasn’t fully aware of what happened during the time he was out cold.

Needless to say Harley forced Peter on bed rest until he was 100% healthy again. He wouldn’t have enjoyed seeing Peter pass out cold for the second time that day. Peter didn’t really mind though, even as he protested against doing so. Harley would get to feed him all week and honestly? Peter wasn’t even going to complain since Harley’s chicken noodle soup was the best in New York. He also didn’t mind the extra bear hugs he got from Harley either.

blog.name: hellzyeahthewebwieldingavenger
blog.title: Hellz Yeah, Spider-Man: The Web Wielding Avenger
blog.description:
A blog all about my love for Peter Benjamin Parker, his friends, family, enemies and world in general. Expect images, rants, musings and long winded essays of the Web Head and why I think he's the greatest comic book Superhero of all time. 

I LOVE comments and questions so leave some as you pass by as well as call me on any facts I have gotten wrong.

Also check out my sub-pages for F.A.Q.s and a key for when I abbreviate.

summary: Marvel Team-Up Volume 4 #3 Thoughts
title: Marvel Team-Up Volume 4 #3 Thoughts
body:
And so comes the end of this arc and I guess Eve Ewing’s whole run???? Didn’t know this was an anthology team up title jeez.

Did it go out with a bang or a whimper? Well…a bit of both.

…And by both I mean there were literal bangs in the issue so the whimpers…you get it…

Okay so for starters the cover lies again like in issue #1. The cover promises us Peter in Kamala’s body with spider powers and Kamala in Peter’s body with Inhuman powers.

And in the issue we get…the same shit from the past 2 issues, standard Freaky Friday.

It’s less bad here than in issue #1 though. Issue #1’s lie was actively reductive to the reading experience. Here it’s just artistic licence and really the idea of seeing Spidey with Kamala’s powers and vice versa is only good for a strong visual. If Peter in Kamala’s body got the same power set it’d seriously undermine the creative legs of the Freaky Friday dynamic in the first place. So a quick cover for an eye catching visual is good enough.

Moving on…this issue is kind of the weakest instalment in this already kind of shakey arc. If you turned your brain off you could kind of enjoy issues #1-2 but the creative energy in this issue was waning a lot.

You can tell this because once the Jackal, the villain of this arc, gets defeated the issue continues for over 11 pages. Over 11 pages of restoring the status quo.

And when I say restoring the status quo I don’t simply mean Peter and Kamala inevitably swap back, I mean they swap back and also forget everything that happened, leaving you wondering what the point of any of this was.

Kamala will go forward in life never knowing the impending dread of job interviews or unpaid bills and Peter Parker will never remember the pain and discomfort of a period or the sweet taste of cotton candy lip gloss…okay maybe for both parties forgetting this ever happened isn’t the worst idea.

But the issue could’ve been mitigated if Ewing had just restructured the story a little bit so that the swap lasted way less than two days. In fact even if they forgot what happened wouldn’t it raise big red flags that 2 days have elapsed within which they remember nothing?

Even putting this aside the story continues the trajectory of having a lot of small problems that add up. Some of these don’t break the issue per se but the numeracy of them adds up to an over all lack of thought and planning put into the story.

Let’s talk about one example I actually forgot to bring up in issue #2. So in the first issue when the Jackal showed up and declared Rosario’s Polly tech would be useful in his cloning experiments my first thought was ‘how’? But I let it slide because maybe the story would elaborate.

And in issue #2 it did but having Spidey throw out a theory, and in issue #3 we got that theory confirmed.

The plan goes like this. The Jackal’s wants to use Rosario’s tech alongside his cloning tech to create clones with the consciousness of another person.

When that happened my thoughts Digivolved from ‘how?’ into ‘why?’

Like…okay, the Jackal has a God complex.

OBVIOUSLY.

Even shitty BND era writers picked up on that.

This would definitely come under the remit of playing God, but even during the nadir of the Clone Saga (we call that Maximum Clonage kids) you could just about see the method in his madness. It wasn’t rationale but it added up within his warped logic. He wanted to destroy life on Earth and replace it with the life HE created.

Cool.

Now in this story he wants to…basically transfer someone’s mind into someone else’s body, but not even their actual body a copy of their actual body.

What possible purpose would that serve?

I could KIND of see it if he wanted to transfer people’s minds into clones of their own bodies. Like what happened to Xavier after he was infected with the Brood.

But into a clone of someone else’s body?

That’s some Underpants Gnome level planning.

Not to mention can’t he basically already do that?

He created the Carrion virus IIRC which genetically reprograms the infected subject into basically believing themselves to be Miles Warren. He was also able to update Ben Reilly’s memories so they’d match Peter Parker’s. If you can do that then surely you could already put someone’s consciousness into a body that isn’t theirs? Or at least the scientific leap from one to the other isn’t that huge.

Another rather significant issue with the plot revolves around the Isotope Genome Accelerator. Yeah remember that? The thing that separated Peter and Spider-Man back in Spencer’s opening arc.

Remember how it heavily implied to explode in ASM v5 #5 and thus merge Peter and Spidey back together? Apparently not. It was either undamaged or got rebuilt apparently. Even better it has plot convenience powers now. It’s used to swap Peter and Kamala again.

So just so we are clear the Isotope Genome Accelerator’s scientific applications include:

-          Irradiating shit

-          Irradiating house spiders to the point where biting people gives them spider powers which may or may not include organic webbing

-          Removing super powered mutations (see Spider-Man: the Final Adventure #4)

-          Temporarily ‘masking’ super powered mutations (see above)

-          Separating people into different sides of themselves (and also maybe creating different clothes for them too?)

-          Swapping people’s minds which is somehow an extension of the latter application

-          Copies and/or transfers the super powers of one person to another (we’ll get back to that)

Holy shit this thing can do everything short of toast bread!

Good lord…the issue tries to explain that it’s ability to separate people into two different entities is how they’re going to affect the swap but…that doesn’t make a lick of sense even by the already bullshit science in play.

How is physically separating the thrill seeking adventurer from the responsible everyman out of the one person (or in theory the man from the cannibalistic lizard monster) remotely similar to swapping the minds of two people?

What did it separate both minds from both bodies and then…they just snapped back to where they belonged?*

This isn’t even mentioning how for what is presumably a gag the Accelerator also apparently gave Rosario Kamala’s powers. How? Why? Does this mean Kamala lost her powers? Does it mean the Accelerator copied her powers into Rosario?

Never explained who fucking knows the Isotope Genome Accelerator is the plot device that just keeps on giving.

There are other lesser contrivances in the issue that are contrivances nevertheless.

Remember how I said in issue #1 how it’s weird that everyone is so concerned about destroying Rosario’s polly device because surely she has the plans to another one? Well this issue confirms she does, she has schematics to another device.

Which raises two big questions.

a)      If the device is going to make all the difference in swapping Peter and Kamala back…why do they need the accelerator? Why the drama and tension over that, they could just build another device and swap back easy peasey

b)      Why was there any tension over destroying the device in issue #1 and thus kicking off this whole arc’s premise?

Another piece of technological contrivance comes from the chip Peter off panel implanted in his brain ages ago without telling the readers. So apparently it was useless all along because it’d only work if whoever was trying to mind swap with him also had a chip.**Oh and it’s eroded away any how.

This is a mind bender this one.

We have a non-Spidey comic by a non-Spidey office establishing Spider-Man did something major that was very smart and very obvious provided it was possible (which we were never led to believe it was in Spidey stories proper). That same non-Spidey comic upon establishing this plot device then uses it as a possible explanation for the scenario it’s setting up. Then in resolving that scenario reveals the plot device wasn’t working, never was going to work, wasn’t a factor in the first place and thus paints Spider-Man as stupid.

WTF!

WTF was the point of the anti-body swap chip then?

You might as well have never had that in the comic and thereby not made Spider-Man storytellers look dumb for not considering that or made the character look dumb for not considering it enough.

Just lose that plot point altogether and nothing changes.

Everything else wrong with this issue is less egregious, it’s smaller things that further spell out the lack of attention being paid to the story.

They range from minor stuff like typos to pretentious narration at the start of the issue.

Not only pretentious by the way but pointless given how they forget what happens and it doesn’t seem to serve the story. It pays lip service to us as people accepting our good and bad traits but…that hasn’t got anything to d with this story in the first place. Also after 2 issues of talking out loud NOW thought captions are a thing?

Let’s see what other shit is wrong with this issue.

Oh right, Rosario has been tied up and conscious in her office at ESU (on a weekday no less) all night but NOBDOY heard her calling for help in all that time? Or she didn’t try yelling before Peter and Kamala conveniently showed up?

Not to mention Kamala says her spider sense (which wasn’t working in the last issue for no explained reason) is alerting her to maybe getting the right location for Rosario but…didn’t they have her office listed? Wasn’t that what they were following? And why would the spider sense (from her and Peter’s POV) tingle if there wasn’t any danger the issue implies it’s the mere fact they’re zeroing in on Rosario.

Other smaller problems include Peter complaining that teens are so mean as though this is a revelation. Peter…Parker…is learning teens can be jerks….um…did Ewing not read Amazing Fantasy #15…page 1…?

Similarly talks about how he’s learned to focus on the problems of the present and not worry about the future. My kneejerk reaction to that is to call BS, Peter clearly does fret over the future.

Final little complaints Spidey bangs on about his knees not hurting when Kamala in his older body never brings them up and seems fine. Aaaaaand there is a line of dialogue from kamala about how the Jackal doesn’t understand that humans are more than bodies and stored ideas yadda yadda yadda,. But like…from her point of view the Jackal never said any of that shit. I guess maybe she’s right but she shouldn’t know to be right if you see what I mean.

I’ll finish off with a little positivity.

The art was lovely again.

Spidey owning Jackal with Kamala’s powers was bad ass.

Spider-Man acting the older mentor figure to Kamala was awesome, just wish it wasn’t undermined by him being in her body when he was doing that.

So all in all…this arc is very unimpressive.

You know how online, maybe on tumblr, maybe on CBR, maybe on Google images or scans daily you see a selection of pages from a comic book story? Basically the highlights?

Yeah if you were to experience issue #1 and #2 like that that’s how I’d recommend experiencing this story.

Reading or God forbid buying it is highly NOT recommended.

*Shit now I think about it the way Roasrio’s device was explained it doesn’t even add up to being able to mind swap. It turns the mind into data and stores it. Okay…how does that mean we’re swapping the minds of two meatbag humans with no mechanical storage device or interface involved?

**Even though again Doc Ock DIDN’T  swap minds with Peter he uploaded a copy of his mind into his head and vice versa, Peter’s real mind was still in his body the whole time but buried.

When that happened my thoughts Digivolved from ‘how?’ into ‘why?’

Like…okay, the Jackal has a God complex.

OBVIOUSLY.

Even shitty BND era writers picked up on that.

This would definitely come under the remit of playing God, but even during the nadir of the Clone Saga (we call that Maximum Clonage kids) you could just about see the method in his madness. It wasn’t rationale but it added up within his warped logic. He wanted to destroy life on Earth and replace it with the life HE created.

Cool.

Now in this story he wants to…basically transfer someone’s mind into someone else’s body, but not even their actual body a copy of their actual body.

What possible purpose would that serve?

I could KIND of see it if he wanted to transfer people’s minds into clones of their own bodies. Like what happened to Xavier after he was infected with the Brood.

But into a clone of someone else’s body?

That’s some Underpants Gnome level planning.

Not to mention can’t he basically already do that?

He created the Carrion virus IIRC which genetically reprograms the infected subject into basically believing themselves to be Miles Warren. He was also able to update Ben Reilly’s memories so they’d match Peter Parker’s. If you can do that then surely you could already put someone’s consciousness into a body that isn’t theirs? Or at least the scientific leap from one to the other isn’t that huge.

Another rather significant issue with the plot revolves around the Isotope Genome Accelerator. Yeah remember that? The thing that separated Peter and Spider-Man back in Spencer’s opening arc.

Remember how it heavily implied to explode in ASM v5 #5 and thus merge Peter and Spidey back together? Apparently not. It was either undamaged or got rebuilt apparently. Even better it has plot convenience powers now. It’s used to swap Peter and Kamala again.

So just so we are clear the Isotope Genome Accelerator’s scientific applications include:

-          Irradiating shit

-          Irradiating house spiders to the point where biting people gives them spider powers which may or may not include organic webbing

-          Removing super powered mutations (see Spider-Man: the Final Adventure #4)

-          Temporarily ‘masking’ super powered mutations (see above)

-          Separating people into different sides of themselves (and also maybe creating different clothes for them too?)

-          Swapping people’s minds which is somehow an extension of the latter application

-          Copies and/or transfers the super powers of one person to another (we’ll get back to that)

Holy shit this thing can do everything short of toast bread!

Good lord…the issue tries to explain that it’s ability to separate people into two different entities is how they’re going to affect the swap but…that doesn’t make a lick of sense even by the already bullshit science in play.

How is physically separating the thrill seeking adventurer from the responsible everyman out of the one person (or in theory the man from the cannibalistic lizard monster) remotely similar to swapping the minds of two people?

What did it separate both minds from both bodies and then…they just snapped back to where they belonged?*

This isn’t even mentioning how for what is presumably a gag the Accelerator also apparently gave Rosario Kamala’s powers. How? Why? Does this mean Kamala lost her powers? Does it mean the Accelerator copied her powers into Rosario?

Never explained who fucking knows the Isotope Genome Accelerator is the plot device that just keeps on giving.

There are other lesser contrivances in the issue that are contrivances nevertheless.

Remember how I said in issue #1 how it’s weird that everyone is so concerned about destroying Rosario’s polly device because surely she has the plans to another one? Well this issue confirms she does, she has schematics to another device.

Which raises two big questions.

a)      If the device is going to make all the difference in swapping Peter and Kamala back…why do they need the accelerator? Why the drama and tension over that, they could just build another device and swap back easy peasey

b)      Why was there any tension over destroying the device in issue #1 and thus kicking off this whole arc’s premise?

Another piece of technological contrivance comes from the chip Peter off panel implanted in his brain ages ago without telling the readers. So apparently it was useless all along because it’d only work if whoever was trying to mind swap with him also had a chip.**Oh and it’s eroded away any how.

This is a mind bender this one.

We have a non-Spidey comic by a non-Spidey office establishing Spider-Man did something major that was very smart and very obvious provided it was possible (which we were never led to believe it was in Spidey stories proper). That same non-Spidey comic upon establishing this plot device then uses it as a possible explanation for the scenario it’s setting up. Then in resolving that scenario reveals the plot device wasn’t working, never was going to work, wasn’t a factor in the first place and thus paints Spider-Man as stupid.

WTF!

WTF was the point of the anti-body swap chip then?

You might as well have never had that in the comic and thereby not made Spider-Man storytellers look dumb for not considering that or made the character look dumb for not considering it enough.

Just lose that plot point altogether and nothing changes.

Everything else wrong with this issue is less egregious, it’s smaller things that further spell out the lack of attention being paid to the story.

They range from minor stuff like typos to pretentious narration at the start of the issue.

Not only pretentious by the way but pointless given how they forget what happens and it doesn’t seem to serve the story. It pays lip service to us as people accepting our good and bad traits but…that hasn’t got anything to d with this story in the first place. Also after 2 issues of talking out loud NOW thought captions are a thing?

Let’s see what other shit is wrong with this issue.

Oh right, Rosario has been tied up and conscious in her office at ESU (on a weekday no less) all night but NOBDOY heard her calling for help in all that time? Or she didn’t try yelling before Peter and Kamala conveniently showed up?

Not to mention Kamala says her spider sense (which wasn’t working in the last issue for no explained reason) is alerting her to maybe getting the right location for Rosario but…didn’t they have her office listed? Wasn’t that what they were following? And why would the spider sense (from her and Peter’s POV) tingle if there wasn’t any danger the issue implies it’s the mere fact they’re zeroing in on Rosario.

Other smaller problems include Peter complaining that teens are so mean as though this is a revelation. Peter…Parker…is learning teens can be jerks….um…did Ewing not read Amazing Fantasy #15…page 1…?

Similarly talks about how he’s learned to focus on the problems of the present and not worry about the future. My kneejerk reaction to that is to call BS, Peter clearly does fret over the future.

Final little complaints Spidey bangs on about his knees not hurting when Kamala in his older body never brings them up and seems fine. Aaaaaand there is a line of dialogue from kamala about how the Jackal doesn’t understand that humans are more than bodies and stored ideas yadda yadda yadda,. But like…from her point of view the Jackal never said any of that shit. I guess maybe she’s right but she shouldn’t know to be right if you see what I mean.

I’ll finish off with a little positivity.

The art was lovely again.

Spidey owning Jackal with Kamala’s powers was bad ass.

Spider-Man acting the older mentor figure to Kamala was awesome, just wish it wasn’t undermined by him being in her body when he was doing that.

So all in all…this arc is very unimpressive.

You know how online, maybe on tumblr, maybe on CBR, maybe on Google images or scans daily you see a selection of pages from a comic book story? Basically the highlights?

Yeah if you were to experience issue #1 and #2 like that that’s how I’d recommend experiencing this story.

Reading or God forbid buying it is highly NOT recommended.

*Shit now I think about it the way Roasrio’s device was explained it doesn’t even add up to being able to mind swap. It turns the mind into data and stores it. Okay…how does that mean we’re swapping the minds of two meatbag humans with no mechanical storage device or interface involved?

**Even though again Doc Ock DIDN’T  swap minds with Peter he uploaded a copy of his mind into his head and vice versa, Peter’s real mind was still in his body the whole time but buried.

trail.content_raw:
And so comes the end of this arc and I guess Eve Ewing’s whole run???? Didn’t know this was an anthology team up title jeez.

Did it go out with a bang or a whimper? Well…a bit of both.

…And by both I mean there were literal bangs in the issue so the whimpers…you get it…

[[MORE]]

It’s less bad here than in issue #1 though. Issue #1’s lie was actively reductive to the reading experience. Here it’s just artistic licence and really the idea of seeing Spidey with Kamala’s powers and vice versa is only good for a strong visual. If Peter in Kamala’s body got the same power set it’d seriously undermine the creative legs of the Freaky Friday dynamic in the first place. So a quick cover for an eye catching visual is good enough.

Moving on…this issue is kind of the weakest instalment in this already kind of shakey arc. If you turned your brain off you could kind of enjoy issues #1-2 but the creative energy in this issue was waning a lot.

Kamala will go forward in life never knowing the impending dread of job interviews or unpaid bills and Peter Parker will never remember the pain and discomfort of a period or the sweet taste of cotton candy lip gloss…okay maybe for both parties forgetting this ever happened isn’t the worst idea.

But the issue could’ve been mitigated if Ewing had just restructured the story a little bit so that the swap lasted way less than two days. In fact even if they forgot what happened wouldn’t it raise big red flags that 2 days have elapsed within which they remember nothing?

summary: Paper Sails
title: Paper Sails
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2wMnNKs

by mega_watzz

He scratched desperately at the hand pinning his throat, to no avail. What made him fight harder was that the grip wasn’t constricting - merely a method of holding him still as he was examined. The measured gaze made his skin crawl, and the unreadable expression in the piercing eyes was definitely not good news whatever it meant. Without his mask, Peter felt even more like a bug under a microscope; the barrier that made him Spiderman was gone, leaving only the unshielded Peter Parker.

–

Or: During the battle on Titan, Thanos sees potential in Peter and takes him.

summary: Wreckless Love - Chapter 10
body:
Wreckless Love - Chapter 10

SUMMERY: You’re the daughter of Tony Stark and have powers that allow you to control nature. As an avenger, things can get crazy. When you and peter get mixed up in that crazy, shit goes boom.

CONTAINS: cursing

PAIRING: Peter Parker x Stark!Reader

A/N: okay well i know this is kind of short but i’m literally writing the next chapter right now and this one isn’t even posted! i haven’t written in forever but here i am and my writer’s block is finally gone,, also school has been crazy and i literally didn’t have time to write, but the school year ended and now i have time!!!

Last Chapter      Next Chapter

Masterlist

“Oh my god, I love this episode haha,” Peter laughed at the current episode of The Office that you were both watching. You sat in your bed, sitting against the headboard and Peter had his arm around you. You couldn’t lie, you were feeling things for him. Not just emotional things, but physical things too.

You stared up at Peter as he watched the TV. He looked down at you and smiled. “What’s up?” He had that gorgeous smile of his plastered across his face. Your face was inches away from his. You could feel his breath against your face.

“Oh nothing,” You turned away before he could catch you blushing. Peter kept staring.

“You’re so pretty.” Your heart skipped a beat as he said that.

“W-what?” You turned to face him, suddenly feeling too close to him.

“I- You heard me. I said you’re pretty. You’re fucking gorgeous actually.” You were flustered. You had no idea what to say to him.

“Peter, I-” He cut you off before you could continue.

“Look, Y/N, I- I know I shouldn’t say this and I know this could… I don’t know, temporarily damage our friendship if you don’t feel the same way, but I don’t care anymore. I can’t hold in the way I feel about you anymore. I’m in love with you Y/N. I know that’s a lot, but it’s true. Everything about you is perfect even your “imperfections.” We have this connection and it’s something that I’ve never felt with anyone else before. I tried pushing these feelings away, but I honestly can’t anymore. Sorry I know that’s probably a lot to take in…” You’d never expected Peter to be confessing his feelings to you in a big, long romantic speech, but you felt the exact same way about him. You just hadn’t had the chance to admit it to yourself until now.

“Peter I- I feel the same way. I haven’t been able to admit it to myself till now because I was afraid that if I did, I would be ruining our friendship. The thing is, I don’t think there is anyone else I want or could be with. You are everything I could ever want in a guy and no one knows me better than you. On top of all of that, it seems like you have this magical power where you’re the only one who has any ability to calm me down, after my panic attacks or nightmares, literally whatever it is. It’s you, Peter.” You looked up at him.

He had a small grin on his face as his eyes flickered between your eyes and your lips. He slid his hand to cup your face, they fit perfectly into each other. “Is this okay?” He asked in the softest voice. You nodded your head.

You moved towards him, his lips capturing yours. Your hands moved into his hair as your lips moved perfectly against each other. It felt like you had this hunger inside of you that needed to be fed, and Peter was the only remedy for it. Peter’s tongue slipped into your mouth, as his hands moved to your waist. He pulled you to straddle his lap. You pulled away from him, resting your forehead against his. His eyes looked into yours. Suddenly, he looked slightly confused. You pulled your face away from his a little.

“Y/N, why are your eyes pink, I thought I had all your colors memorized.” His hands slid onto your face, as he looked at your eyes. You blushed as you remembered.

“Oh yea I- well I was never really able to show you or anyone else for that matter, it’s a color that only I’ve ever seen. It sort of a mix of romantic feelings, lust, sexual desire, and/or being turned on. I’m definitely all of the above. I’ve noticed that the tone of pink changes depending on if it’s more romantic or sexual.” Peter smirked as he pulled you into a hug with you still in his lap.

“I fucking love that I do those things to you.” He giggled.

“Stop, oh my god Pete! Look, I think we should stop this for tonight, I mean we just confessed our feelings to each other. I don’t think we should go further than kissing just for tonight. I know we’re gonna move fast considering that we were basically dating before except we acted like friends, but I don’t think we should have sex tonight. Trust me I want to, oh my god I want to. Let’s just relax together and watch The Office for the rest of the night. Plus today has been an overwhelming day.” You moved off of Peter’s lap and back to where you were before.

“You literally took the words out of my mouth. We need to explore this a little before we go there, but trust me, I wanna go there too, holy shit. Also your pink eyes are sexy as hell. Well actually everything about you is sexy as hell.” He gave you a quick peck on the lips and turned the show back on, leaving you blushing. “Sorry I couldn’t resist.” He giggled.

“It’s more than alright, and if it makes you feel any better, you’re also sexy as hell. I would honestly be lying if I said I haven’t dreamt about you boxing shirtless in the gym.” You laughed and cuddled into his side. He turned and looked at you with his eyebrows raised.

“Oh yea, is that so? Well, I’ve had my fair share of dreams about you, and not all of them have been clean… but if we continue this conversation, I will literally have to leave this room because if not I won’t be able to resist you.” You both laughed at Peter’s comment.

*******

Tony opened the door to your room. Both you and Peter were laying cuddled asleep in your bed with The Office still playing on the TV. There was something different about it this time though. You were closer and your legs were tangled in his. He knew what had happened. He smiled. “Finally.” He said to himself. He closed the door and left as if he hadn’t seen anything.

Next Chapter

Series Masterlist

You stared up at Peter as he watched the TV. He looked down at you and smiled. “What’s up?” He had that gorgeous smile of his plastered across his face. Your face was inches away from his. You could feel his breath against your face.

“Oh nothing,” You turned away before he could catch you blushing. Peter kept staring.

“You’re so pretty.” Your heart skipped a beat as he said that.

“W-what?” You turned to face him, suddenly feeling too close to him.

“I- You heard me. I said you’re pretty. You’re fucking gorgeous actually.” You were flustered. You had no idea what to say to him.

“Peter, I-” He cut you off before you could continue.

“Look, Y/N, I- I know I shouldn’t say this and I know this could… I don’t know, temporarily damage our friendship if you don’t feel the same way, but I don’t care anymore. I can’t hold in the way I feel about you anymore. I’m in love with you Y/N. I know that’s a lot, but it’s true. Everything about you is perfect even your “imperfections.” We have this connection and it’s something that I’ve never felt with anyone else before. I tried pushing these feelings away, but I honestly can’t anymore. Sorry I know that’s probably a lot to take in…” You’d never expected Peter to be confessing his feelings to you in a big, long romantic speech, but you felt the exact same way about him. You just hadn’t had the chance to admit it to yourself until now.

“Peter I- I feel the same way. I haven’t been able to admit it to myself till now because I was afraid that if I did, I would be ruining our friendship. The thing is, I don’t think there is anyone else I want or could be with. You are everything I could ever want in a guy and no one knows me better than you. On top of all of that, it seems like you have this magical power where you’re the only one who has any ability to calm me down, after my panic attacks or nightmares, literally whatever it is. It’s you, Peter.” You looked up at him.

He had a small grin on his face as his eyes flickered between your eyes and your lips. He slid his hand to cup your face, they fit perfectly into each other. “Is this okay?” He asked in the softest voice. You nodded your head.

You moved towards him, his lips capturing yours. Your hands moved into his hair as your lips moved perfectly against each other. It felt like you had this hunger inside of you that needed to be fed, and Peter was the only remedy for it. Peter’s tongue slipped into your mouth, as his hands moved to your waist. He pulled you to straddle his lap. You pulled away from him, resting your forehead against his. His eyes looked into yours. Suddenly, he looked slightly confused. You pulled your face away from his a little.

“Y/N, why are your eyes pink, I thought I had all your colors memorized.” His hands slid onto your face, as he looked at your eyes. You blushed as you remembered.

“Oh yea I- well I was never really able to show you or anyone else for that matter, it’s a color that only I’ve ever seen. It sort of a mix of romantic feelings, lust, sexual desire, and/or being turned on. I’m definitely all of the above. I’ve noticed that the tone of pink changes depending on if it’s more romantic or sexual.” Peter smirked as he pulled you into a hug with you still in his lap.

“I fucking love that I do those things to you.” He giggled.

“Stop, oh my god Pete! Look, I think we should stop this for tonight, I mean we just confessed our feelings to each other. I don’t think we should go further than kissing just for tonight. I know we’re gonna move fast considering that we were basically dating before except we acted like friends, but I don’t think we should have sex tonight. Trust me I want to, oh my god I want to. Let’s just relax together and watch The Office for the rest of the night. Plus today has been an overwhelming day.” You moved off of Peter’s lap and back to where you were before.

“You literally took the words out of my mouth. We need to explore this a little before we go there, but trust me, I wanna go there too, holy shit. Also your pink eyes are sexy as hell. Well actually everything about you is sexy as hell.” He gave you a quick peck on the lips and turned the show back on, leaving you blushing. “Sorry I couldn’t resist.” He giggled.

“It’s more than alright, and if it makes you feel any better, you’re also sexy as hell. I would honestly be lying if I said I haven’t dreamt about you boxing shirtless in the gym.” You laughed and cuddled into his side. He turned and looked at you with his eyebrows raised.

“Oh yea, is that so? Well, I’ve had my fair share of dreams about you, and not all of them have been clean… but if we continue this conversation, I will literally have to leave this room because if not I won’t be able to resist you.” You both laughed at Peter’s comment.

*******

Tony opened the door to your room. Both you and Peter were laying cuddled asleep in your bed with The Office still playing on the TV. There was something different about it this time though. You were closer and your legs were tangled in his. He knew what had happened. He smiled. “Finally.” He said to himself. He closed the door and left as if he hadn’t seen anything.

Next Chapter

title: Elmer Glue Our Hearts and Jumpstart Them Until We Can Breathe Again - Chapter 1 - MCUsic_to_my_ears - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]

description:
“Who said you could drive again?”

“My five years on Fury Road, now shut up, Parker!” Harley hollered as he whizzed through a yellow light.

“Mommy said that’s a bad word!” Morgan announced, her hair twisted around in a crown at the front of her head.

“Yeah, well what Mommy doesn’t know won’t kill her, got it, kid?”

/////

Peter, Harley, and Morgan never realized how Tony brought them together.

***

A series of interactions between the Iron Children.

/////

Just uploaded the next chapter! Four more to go!
